Description_Hindi: Call connected, but instead of the customer, a family member or third person answered; customer unavailable, asked to call later.
Call connected but got disconnected instantly, and no meaningful conversation happened (customer disconnected / network drop).
The call went to voicemail or an answering machine; the bot/agent left a generic EMI reminder message.
The person on the number clearly stated that this is not the customer’s number or they do not know the customer.
A family member or third person informed that the customer has passed away.
During the call, the customer raised a complaint or dispute related to loan/EMI/charges/process (e.g., loan not taken, auto-debit issue, etc.).
The correct customer is on the line and clearly states that they will not pay the EMI or outstanding amount.
Customer confirms that sufficient balance will be available before the 5th for EMI (client-specific use-case).
Customer confirms that sufficient balance will be available before the 10th for EMI (client-specific use-case).

Disposition_Label: Promise to Pay – On Due Date
Description_Hindi: Customer says the full EMI amount will be available by the due date or same day and auto-debit will be successful (YES-path or NO → YES).
Customer promises to deposit the amount by a specific date (due date or any agreed date); PTP date is logged.
Customer says EMI is already paid but receipt/screenshot or proof has not yet been shared; secure link sent.
Payment proof (receipt/screenshot) sent by the customer has been successfully received/uploaded and forwarded for verification.
Customer is willing but cannot pay the EMI now due to salary delay; requires escalation/follow-up.
Customer lost their job or income has stopped, so they are unable to pay EMI; for hardship/restructuring evaluation.
Customer or family member has a serious medical condition, making payment temporarily difficult; high-empathy escalation as per script.
Customer wants to pay but cannot due to UPI/net-banking/app/bank technical issues.
Customer intends to pay but faces difficulty in this EMI due to other reasons (travel, family issues, etc.).
Correct customer is on the line but cannot talk right now; clearly requests a callback at another time or slot.
Customer clearly states that they do not want further calls or promotional communication regarding this loan/EMI (DND / consent withdrawal).
Call attempt shows busy tone or gets disconnected during ringing; no conversation happened.
Phone kept ringing but no one answered; no interaction.
Telecom message states that the number is switched off or not reachable; call did not connect.
Telecom message indicates the number is out of network coverage; needs retry later.
Dialed mobile number is invalid or not in service; technical correction/data cleanup required.
Call could not be completed due to network/system errors (signalling failure, etc.); auto-retry can be attempted later.
